entries.meaning: (colloquial, uncountable) Any alcoholic beverage. (Especially hard liquor.)
examples: She got caught between the shadows and the booze
And she surely did know how to have the blues

entries.meaning: (colloquial, countable, archaic) A session of drinking alcohol; a drinking party.

verbs.description: booze (third-person singular simple present boozes, present participle boozing, simple past and past participle boozed)

examples: We were out all night boozing until we dragged ourselves home hung over.
